properties.name: Alcoa High School, Alcoa, TN
properties.description: Posted by Zpeddico Although I never won a game against Alcoa (3-time defending state football champion), I always loved playing here. My sophomore year in high school, I was the only underclassman starter. The regular season game with them was the state\'s No. 1 (Alcoa) vs. No. 2 (Rockwood) ranked teams. Even though we lost, it was an incredible atmosphere that night. The game was even on TV!!!

properties.name: Christian Brothers High School, Memphis, TN
properties.description: Posted by Zpeddico Baseball State Tournament 2004. We didn\'t win, but it was certainly an awesome experience.

properties.name: Dr. Tom Evans Gymnasium, Rockwood, TN
properties.description: Posted by Zpeddico The atmosphere in the gym is absolutely electric when it comes time for the post-season. I remember countless times when my coach had flash cards for the plays because the crowd was so loud. Oh yea, I was pumped.

properties.name: Gatlinburg-Pittman High School, Gatlinburg, TN
properties.description: Posted by Zpeddico First round of the football playoffs, 2005. It was very cold, and wet. We won this game by a score of 10-6. It was ugly, nicknamed, "The Mud Bowl".

properties.name: Happy Valley High School, Elizabethton, TN
properties.description: Posted by Zpeddico I played my first playoff game in football here. I was a freshman, and all I did was punt. I loved the playoff atmosphere in the freezing cold and light snow. I\'ll never forget it.

properties.name: Harriman High School, Harriman, TN
properties.description: Posted by Zpeddico Harriman was our (Rockwood) biggest rivals throughout high school, in all three major sports: basketball, football, and baseball. The two schools also hold the longest running rivalry in the state of TN, playing each other every year but one (World War 2) since 1921. This is another great place for high school sports.

properties.name: Kingston High School, Kingston, TN
properties.description: Posted by Zpeddico There is always a back and forth rivalry between Rockwood and Kingston. It is fantastic atmosphere for both basketball and football, and i loved playing sports there.

properties.name: Middle Tennessee State University, Murfreesboro, TN
properties.description: Posted by ZpeddicoState basketball tournament 2004. Enough said.

properties.name: Unaka High School, Elizabethton, TN
properties.description: Posted by Zpeddico I\'ve only played here once, but it was in the sub-state game of my sophomore year. I\'ve never played in a more crowded gym in my life. I couldn\'t hear myself think, let alone hear anyone else on the court, including the referees. It was amazing.

properties.name: Wartburg Central High School, Wartburg, TN
properties.description: Posted by Zpeddico This was a huge basketball game every year for Rockwood and Wartburg. Everyone circled their calendars for this game. I\'ll just say that they closed most of the stores in town for this game, the signs said, " closed: Went to watch Wartburg beat Rockwood". Believe it or not, I\'m not lying.
